speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Goneril.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Who stock'd my servant? Regan, I have good hope Thou didst not know on't.- Who comes here? O heavens! If you do love old men, if your sweet sway Allow obedience- if yourselves are old, Make it your cause! Send down, and take my part! [To Goneril] Art not asham'd to look upon this beard?- O Regan, wilt thou take her by the hand?

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: Why not by th' hand, sir? How have I offended? All's not offence that indiscretion finds And dotage terms so.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: O sides, you are too tough! Will you yet hold? How came my man i' th' stocks?

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: I set him there, sir; but his own disorders Deserv'd much less advancement.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: You? Did you?

speaker: Regan
turn_text: I pray you, father, being weak, seem so. If, till the expiration of your month, You will return and sojourn with my sister, Dismissing half your train, come then to me. I am now from home, and out of that provision Which shall be needful for your entertainment.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Return to her, and fifty men dismiss'd? No, rather I abjure all roofs, and choose To wage against the enmity o' th' air, To be a comrade with the wolf and owl- Necessity's sharp pinch! Return with her? Why, the hot-blooded France, that dowerless took Our youngest born, I could as well be brought To knee his throne, and, squire-like, pension beg To keep base life afoot. Return with her? Persuade me rather to be slave and sumpter To this detested groom. [Points at Oswald.]

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: At your choice, sir.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: I prithee, daughter, do not make me mad. I will not trouble thee, my child; farewell. We'll no more meet, no more see one another. But yet thou art my flesh, my blood, my daughter; Or rather a disease that's in my flesh, Which I must needs call mine. Thou art a boil, A plague sore, an embossed carbuncle In my corrupted blood. But I'll not chide thee. Let shame come when it will, I do not call it. I do not bid the Thunder-bearer shoot Nor tell tales of thee to high-judging Jove. Mend when thou canst; be better at thy leisure; I can be patient, I can stay with Regan, I and my hundred knights.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Not altogether so. I look'd not for you yet, nor am provided For your fit welcome. Give ear, sir, to my sister; For those that mingle reason with your passion Must be content to think you old, and so- But she knows what she does.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Is this well spoken?

speaker: Regan
turn_text: I dare avouch it, sir. What, fifty followers? Is it not well? What should you need of more? Yea, or so many, sith that both charge and danger Speak 'gainst so great a number? How in one house Should many people, under two commands, Hold amity? 'Tis hard; almost impossible.

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: Why might not you, my lord, receive attendance From those that she calls servants, or from mine?

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Why not, my lord? If then they chanc'd to slack ye, We could control them. If you will come to me (For now I spy a danger), I entreat you To bring but five-and-twenty. To no more Will I give place or notice.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: I gave you all-

speaker: Regan
turn_text: And in good time you gave it!

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Made you my guardians, my depositaries; But kept a reservation to be followed With such a number. What, must I come to you With five-and-twenty, Regan? Said you so?

speaker: Regan
turn_text: And speak't again my lord. No more with me.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Those wicked creatures yet do look well-favour'd When others are more wicked; not being the worst Stands in some rank of praise. [To Goneril] I'll go with thee. Thy fifty yet doth double five-and-twenty, And thou art twice her love.

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: Hear, me, my lord. What need you five-and-twenty, ten, or five, To follow in a house where twice so many Have a command to tend you?

speaker: Regan
turn_text: What need one?

speaker: Lear
turn_text: O, reason not the need! Our basest beggars Are in the poorest thing superfluous. Allow not nature more than nature needs, Man's life is cheap as beast's. Thou art a lady: If only to go warm were gorgeous, Why, nature needs not what thou gorgeous wear'st Which scarcely keeps thee warm. But, for true need- You heavens, give me that patience, patience I need! You see me here, you gods, a poor old man, As full of grief as age; wretched in both. If it be you that stirs these daughters' hearts Against their father, fool me not so much To bear it tamely; touch me with noble anger, And let not women's weapons, water drops, Stain my man's cheeks! No, you unnatural hags! I will have such revenges on you both That all the world shall- I will do such things- What they are yet, I know not; but they shall be The terrors of the earth! You think I'll weep. No, I'll not weep. I have full cause of weeping, but this heart Shall break into a hundred thousand flaws Or ere I'll weep. O fool, I shall go mad!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt Lear, Gloucester, Kent, and Fool. Storm and tempest.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Let us withdraw; 'twill be a storm.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: This house is little; the old man and 's people Cannot be well bestow'd.

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: 'Tis his own blame; hath put himself from rest And must needs taste his folly.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: For his particular, I'll receive him gladly, But not one follower.

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: So am I purpos'd. Where is my Lord of Gloucester?

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Followed the old man forth.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Gloucester.

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: He is return'd.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: The King is in high rage.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Whither is he going?

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: He calls to horse, but will I know not whither.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: 'Tis best to give him way; he leads himself.

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: My lord, entreat him by no means to stay.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Alack, the night comes on, and the bleak winds Do sorely ruffle. For many miles about There's scarce a bush.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: O, sir, to wilful men The injuries that they themselves procure Must be their schoolmasters. Shut up your doors. He is attended with a desperate train, And what they may incense him to, being apt To have his ear abus'd, wisdom bids fear.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Shut up your doors, my lord: 'tis a wild night. My Regan counsels well. Come out o' th' storm.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Storm still. Enter Kent and a Gentleman at several doors.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Who's there, besides foul weather?

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: One minded like the weather, most unquietly.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: I know you. Where's the King?

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Contending with the fretful elements; Bids the wind blow the earth into the sea, Or swell the curled waters 'bove the main, That things might change or cease; tears his white hair, Which the impetuous blasts, with eyeless rage, Catch in their fury and make nothing of; Strives in his little world of man to outscorn The to-and-fro-conflicting wind and rain. This night, wherein the cub-drawn bear would couch, The lion and the belly-pinched wolf Keep their fur dry, unbonneted he runs, And bids what will take all.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: But who is with him?

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: None but the fool, who labours to outjest His heart-struck injuries.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Sir, I do know you, And dare upon the warrant of my note Commend a dear thing to you. There is division (Although as yet the face of it be cover'd With mutual cunning) 'twixt Albany and Cornwall; Who have (as who have not, that their great stars Thron'd and set high?) servants, who seem no less, Which are to France the spies and speculations Intelligent of our state. What hath been seen, Either in snuffs and packings of the Dukes, Or the hard rein which both of them have borne Against the old kind King, or something deeper, Whereof, perchance, these are but furnishings- But, true it is, from France there comes a power Into this scattered kingdom, who already, Wise in our negligence, have secret feet In some of our best ports and are at point To show their open banner. Now to you: If on my credit you dare build so far To make your speed to Dover, you shall find Some that will thank you, making just report Of how unnatural and bemadding sorrow The King hath cause to plain. I am a gentleman of blood and breeding, And from some knowledge and assurance offer This office to you.

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: I will talk further with you.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: No, do not. For confirmation that I am much more Than my out-wall, open this purse and take What it contains. If you shall see Cordelia (As fear not but you shall), show her this ring, And she will tell you who your fellow is That yet you do not know. Fie on this storm! I will go seek the King.

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Give me your hand. Have you no more to say?

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Few words, but, to effect, more than all yet: That, when we have found the King (in which your pain That way, I'll this), he that first lights on him Holla the other.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt [severally].

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Storm still. Enter Lear and Fool.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow! You cataracts and hurricanoes, spout Till you have drench'd our steeples, drown'd the cocks! You sulph'rous and thought-executing fires, Vaunt-couriers to oak-cleaving thunderbolts, Singe my white head! And thou, all-shaking thunder, Strike flat the thick rotundity o' th' world, Crack Nature's moulds, all germains spill at once, That makes ingrateful man!

speaker: Fool
turn_text: O nuncle, court holy water in a dry house is better than this rain water out o' door. Good nuncle, in, and ask thy daughters blessing! Here's a night pities nether wise men nor fools.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Rumble thy bellyful! Spit, fire! spout, rain! Nor rain, wind, thunder, fire are my daughters. I tax not you, you elements, with unkindness. I never gave you kingdom, call'd you children, You owe me no subscription. Then let fall Your horrible pleasure. Here I stand your slave, A poor, infirm, weak, and despis'd old man. But yet I call you servile ministers, That will with two pernicious daughters join Your high-engender'd battles 'gainst a head So old and white as this! O! O! 'tis foul!

speaker: Fool
turn_text: He that has a house to put 's head in has a good head-piece. The codpiece that will house Before the head has any, The head and he shall louse: So beggars marry many. The man that makes his toe What he his heart should make Shall of a corn cry woe, And turn his sleep to wake. For there was never yet fair woman but she made mouths in a glass.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Kent.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: No, I will be the pattern of all patience; I will say nothing.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Who's there?

speaker: Fool
turn_text: Marry, here's grace and a codpiece; that's a wise man and a fool.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Alas, sir, are you here? Things that love night Love not such nights as these. The wrathful skies Gallow the very wanderers of the dark And make them keep their caves. Since I was man, Such sheets of fire, such bursts of horrid thunder, Such groans of roaring wind and rain, I never Remember to have heard. Man's nature cannot carry Th' affliction nor the fear.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Let the great gods, That keep this dreadful pudder o'er our heads, Find out their enemies now. Tremble, thou wretch, That hast within thee undivulged crimes Unwhipp'd of justice. Hide thee, thou bloody hand; Thou perjur'd, and thou simular man of virtue That art incestuous. Caitiff, in pieces shake That under covert and convenient seeming Hast practis'd on man's life. Close pent-up guilts, Rive your concealing continents, and cry These dreadful summoners grace. I am a man More sinn'd against than sinning.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Alack, bareheaded? Gracious my lord, hard by here is a hovel; Some friendship will it lend you 'gainst the tempest. Repose you there, whilst I to this hard house (More harder than the stones whereof 'tis rais'd, Which even but now, demanding after you, Denied me to come in) return, and force Their scanted courtesy.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: My wits begin to turn. Come on, my boy. How dost, my boy? Art cold? I am cold myself. Where is this straw, my fellow? The art of our necessities is strange, That can make vile things precious. Come, your hovel. Poor fool and knave, I have one part in my heart That's sorry yet for thee.

speaker: Fool
turn_text: [sings] He that has and a little tiny wit- With hey, ho, the wind and the rain- Must make content with his fortunes fit, For the rain it raineth every day.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: True, my good boy. Come, bring us to this hovel.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt [Lear and Kent].

speaker: Fool
turn_text: This is a brave night to cool a courtesan. I'll speak a prophecy ere I go: When priests are more in word than matter; When brewers mar their malt with water; When nobles are their tailors' tutors, No heretics burn'd, but wenches' suitors; When every case in law is right, No squire in debt nor no poor knight; When slanders do not live in tongues, Nor cutpurses come not to throngs; When usurers tell their gold i' th' field, And bawds and whores do churches build: Then shall the realm of Albion Come to great confusion. Then comes the time, who lives to see't, That going shall be us'd with feet. This prophecy Merlin shall make, for I live before his time.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Gloucester and Edmund.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Alack, alack, Edmund, I like not this unnatural dealing! When I desir'd their leave that I might pity him, they took from me the use of mine own house, charg'd me on pain of perpetual displeasure neither to speak of him, entreat for him, nor any way sustain him.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: Most savage and unnatural!

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Go to; say you nothing. There is division betwixt the Dukes, and a worse matter than that. I have received a letter this night- 'tis dangerous to be spoken- I have lock'd the letter in my closet. These injuries the King now bears will be revenged home; there's part of a power already footed; we must incline to the King. I will seek him and privily relieve him. Go you and maintain talk with the Duke, that my charity be not of him perceived. If he ask for me, I am ill and gone to bed. Though I die for't, as no less is threat'ned me, the King my old master must be relieved. There is some strange thing toward, Edmund. Pray you be careful.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: This courtesy, forbid thee, shall the Duke Instantly know, and of that letter too. This seems a fair deserving, and must draw me That which my father loses- no less than all. The younger rises when the old doth fall.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Storm still. Enter Lear, Kent, and Fool.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Here is the place, my lord. Good my lord, enter. The tyranny of the open night 's too rough For nature to endure.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Let me alone.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Good my lord, enter here.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Wilt break my heart?

speaker: Kent
turn_text: I had rather break mine own. Good my lord, enter.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Thou think'st 'tis much that this contentious storm Invades us to the skin. So 'tis to thee; But where the greater malady is fix'd, The lesser is scarce felt. Thou'dst shun a bear; But if thy flight lay toward the raging sea, Thou'dst meet the bear i' th' mouth. When the mind's free, The body's delicate. The tempest in my mind Doth from my senses take all feeling else Save what beats there. Filial ingratitude! Is it not as this mouth should tear this hand For lifting food to't? But I will punish home! No, I will weep no more. In such a night 'To shut me out! Pour on; I will endure. In such a night as this! O Regan, Goneril! Your old kind father, whose frank heart gave all! O, that way madness lies; let me shun that! No more of that.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Good my lord, enter here.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Prithee go in thyself; seek thine own ease. This tempest will not give me leave to ponder On things would hurt me more. But I'll go in. [To the Fool] In, boy; go first.- You houseless poverty- Nay, get thee in. I'll pray, and then I'll sleep.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit [Fool].

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Poor naked wretches, wheresoe'er you are, That bide the pelting of this pitiless storm, How shall your houseless heads and unfed sides, Your loop'd and window'd raggedness, defend you From seasons such as these? O, I have ta'en Too little care of this! Take physic, pomp; Expose thyself to feel what wretches feel, That thou mayst shake the superflux to them And show the heavens more just.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: [within] Fathom and half, fathom and half! Poor Tom!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Fool [from the hovel].

speaker: Fool
turn_text: Come not in here, nuncle, here's a spirit. Help me, help me!

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Give me thy hand. Who's there?

speaker: Fool
turn_text: A spirit, a spirit! He says his name's poor Tom.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: What art thou that dost grumble there i' th' straw? Come forth.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Edgar [disguised as a madman].

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Away! the foul fiend follows me! Through the sharp hawthorn blows the cold wind. Humh! go to thy cold bed, and warm thee.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Hast thou given all to thy two daughters, and art thou come to this?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Who gives anything to poor Tom? whom the foul fiend hath led through fire and through flame, through ford and whirlpool, o'er bog and quagmire; that hath laid knives under his pillow and halters in his pew, set ratsbane by his porridge, made him proud of heart, to ride on a bay trotting horse over four-inch'd bridges, to course his own shadow for a traitor. Bless thy five wits! Tom 's acold. O, do de, do de, do de. Bless thee from whirlwinds, star-blasting, and taking! Do poor Tom some charity, whom the foul fiend vexes. There could I have him now- and there- and there again- and there!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Storm still.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: What, have his daughters brought him to this pass? Couldst thou save nothing? Didst thou give 'em all?

speaker: Fool
turn_text: Nay, he reserv'd a blanket, else we had been all sham'd.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Now all the plagues that in the pendulous air Hang fated o'er men's faults light on thy daughters!

speaker: Kent
turn_text: He hath no daughters, sir.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Death, traitor! nothing could have subdu'd nature To such a lowness but his unkind daughters. Is it the fashion that discarded fathers Should have thus little mercy on their flesh? Judicious punishment! 'Twas this flesh begot Those pelican daughters.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Pillicock sat on Pillicock's Hill. 'Allow, 'allow, loo, loo!

speaker: Fool
turn_text: This cold night will turn us all to fools and madmen.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Take heed o' th' foul fiend; obey thy parents: keep thy word justly; swear not; commit not with man's sworn spouse; set not thy sweet heart on proud array. Tom 's acold.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: What hast thou been?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: A servingman, proud in heart and mind; that curl'd my hair, wore gloves in my cap; serv'd the lust of my mistress' heart and did the act of darkness with her; swore as many oaths as I spake words, and broke them in the sweet face of heaven; one that slept in the contriving of lust, and wak'd to do it. Wine lov'd I deeply, dice dearly; and in woman out-paramour'd the Turk. False of heart, light of ear, bloody of hand; hog in sloth, fox in stealth, wolf in greediness, dog in madness, lion in prey. Let not the creaking of shoes nor the rustling of silks betray thy poor heart to woman. Keep thy foot out of brothel, thy hand out of placket, thy pen from lender's book, and defy the foul fiend. Still through the hawthorn blows the cold wind; says suum, mun, hey, no, nonny. Dolphin my boy, my boy, sessa! let him trot by.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Storm still.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Why, thou wert better in thy grave than to answer with thy uncover'd body this extremity of the skies. Is man no more than this? Consider him well. Thou ow'st the worm no silk, the beast no hide, the sheep no wool, the cat no perfume. Ha! Here's three on's are sophisticated! Thou art the thing itself; unaccommodated man is no more but such a poor, bare, forked animal as thou art. Off, off, you lendings! Come, unbutton here. [Tears at his clothes.]

speaker: Fool
turn_text: Prithee, nuncle, be contented! 'Tis a naughty night to swim in. Now a little fire in a wild field were like an old lecher's heart- a small spark, all the rest on's body cold. Look, here comes a walking fire.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Gloucester with a torch.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: This is the foul fiend Flibbertigibbet. He begins at curfew, and walks till the first cock. He gives the web and the pin, squints the eye, and makes the harelip; mildews the white wheat, and hurts the poor creature of earth. Saint Withold footed thrice the 'old; He met the nightmare, and her nine fold; Bid her alight And her troth plight, And aroint thee, witch, aroint thee!

speaker: Kent
turn_text: How fares your Grace?

speaker: Lear
turn_text: What's he?

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Who's there? What is't you seek?

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: What are you there? Your names?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Poor Tom, that eats the swimming frog, the toad, the todpole, the wall-newt and the water; that in the fury of his heart, when the foul fiend rages, eats cow-dung for sallets, swallows the old rat and the ditch-dog, drinks the green mantle of the standing pool; who is whipp'd from tithing to tithing, and stock-punish'd and imprison'd; who hath had three suits to his back, six shirts to his body, horse to ride, and weapons to wear; But mice and rats, and such small deer, Have been Tom's food for seven long year. Beware my follower. Peace, Smulkin! peace, thou fiend!

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: What, hath your Grace no better company?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: The prince of darkness is a gentleman! Modo he's call'd, and Mahu.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Our flesh and blood is grown so vile, my lord, That it doth hate what gets it.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Poor Tom 's acold.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Go in with me. My duty cannot suffer T' obey in all your daughters' hard commands. Though their injunction be to bar my doors And let this tyrannous night take hold upon you, Yet have I ventur'd to come seek you out And bring you where both fire and food is ready.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: First let me talk with this philosopher. What is the cause of thunder?

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Good my lord, take his offer; go into th' house.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: I'll talk a word with this same learned Theban. What is your study?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: How to prevent the fiend and to kill vermin.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Let me ask you one word in private.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Importune him once more to go, my lord. His wits begin t' unsettle.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Canst thou blame him? His daughters seek his death. Ah, that good Kent! He said it would be thus- poor banish'd man! Thou say'st the King grows mad: I'll tell thee, friend, I am almost mad myself. I had a son, Now outlaw'd from my blood. He sought my life But lately, very late. I lov'd him, friend- No father his son dearer. True to tell thee, The grief hath craz'd my wits. What a night 's this! I do beseech your Grace-

speaker: Lear
turn_text: O, cry you mercy, sir. Noble philosopher, your company.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Tom's acold.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: In, fellow, there, into th' hovel; keep thee warm.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Come, let's in all.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: This way, my lord.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: With him! I will keep still with my philosopher.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Good my lord, soothe him; let him take the fellow.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Take him you on.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Sirrah, come on; go along with us.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Come, good Athenian.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: No words, no words! hush.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Child Rowland to the dark tower came; His word was still Fie, foh, and fum! I smell the blood of a British man.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Cornwall and Edmund.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: I will have my revenge ere I depart his house.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: How, my lord, I may be censured, that nature thus gives way to loyalty, something fears me to think of.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: I now perceive it was not altogether your brother's evil disposition made him seek his death; but a provoking merit, set awork by a reproveable badness in himself.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: How malicious is my fortune that I must repent to be just! This is the letter he spoke of, which approves him an intelligent party to the advantages of France. O heavens! that this treason were not- or not I the detector!

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Go with me to the Duchess.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: If the matter of this paper be certain, you have mighty business in hand.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: True or false, it hath made thee Earl of Gloucester. Seek out where thy father is, that he may be ready for our apprehension.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: [aside] If I find him comforting the King, it will stuff his suspicion more fully.- I will persever in my course of loyalty, though the conflict be sore between that and my blood.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: I will lay trust upon thee, and thou shalt find a dearer father in my love.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Gloucester, Lear, Kent, Fool, and Edgar.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Here is better than the open air; take it thankfully. I will piece out the comfort with what addition I can. I will not be long from you.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: All the power of his wits have given way to his impatience. The gods reward your kindness!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit [Gloucester].

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Frateretto calls me, and tells me Nero is an angler in the lake of darkness. Pray, innocent, and beware the foul fiend.

speaker: Fool
turn_text: Prithee, nuncle, tell me whether a madman be a gentleman or a yeoman.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: A king, a king!

speaker: Fool
turn_text: No, he's a yeoman that has a gentleman to his son; for he's a mad yeoman that sees his son a gentleman before him.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: To have a thousand with red burning spits Come hizzing in upon 'em-

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: The foul fiend bites my back.

speaker: Fool
turn_text: He's mad that trusts in the tameness of a wolf, a horse's health, a boy's love, or a whore's oath.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: It shall be done; I will arraign them straight. [To Edgar] Come, sit thou here, most learned justicer. [To the Fool] Thou, sapient sir, sit here. Now, you she-foxes!

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Look, where he stands and glares! Want'st thou eyes at trial, madam? Come o'er the bourn, Bessy, to me.

speaker: Fool
turn_text: Her boat hath a leak, And she must not speak Why she dares not come over to thee.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: The foul fiend haunts poor Tom in the voice of a nightingale. Hoppedance cries in Tom's belly for two white herring. Croak not, black angel; I have no food for thee.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: How do you, sir? Stand you not so amaz'd. Will you lie down and rest upon the cushions?

speaker: Lear
turn_text: I'll see their trial first. Bring in their evidence. [To Edgar] Thou, robed man of justice, take thy place. [To the Fool] And thou, his yokefellow of equity, Bench by his side. [To Kent] You are o' th' commission, Sit you too.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Let us deal justly. Sleepest or wakest thou, jolly shepherd? Thy sheep be in the corn; And for one blast of thy minikin mouth Thy sheep shall take no harm. Purr! the cat is gray.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Arraign her first. 'Tis Goneril. I here take my oath before this honourable assembly, she kicked the poor King her father.

speaker: Fool
turn_text: Come hither, mistress. Is your name Goneril?

speaker: Lear
turn_text: She cannot deny it.

speaker: Fool
turn_text: Cry you mercy, I took you for a joint-stool.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: And here's another, whose warp'd looks proclaim What store her heart is made on. Stop her there! Arms, arms! sword! fire! Corruption in the place! False justicer, why hast thou let her scape?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Bless thy five wits!

speaker: Kent
turn_text: O pity! Sir, where is the patience now That you so oft have boasted to retain?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: [aside] My tears begin to take his part so much They'll mar my counterfeiting.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: The little dogs and all, Tray, Blanch, and Sweetheart, see, they bark at me.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Tom will throw his head at them. Avaunt, you curs! Be thy mouth or black or white, Tooth that poisons if it bite; Mastiff, greyhound, mongrel grim, Hound or spaniel, brach or lym, Bobtail tyke or trundle-tall- Tom will make them weep and wail; For, with throwing thus my head, Dogs leap the hatch, and all are fled. Do de, de, de. Sessa! Come, march to wakes and fairs and market towns. Poor Tom, thy horn is dry.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Then let them anatomize Regan. See what breeds about her heart. Is there any cause in nature that makes these hard hearts? [To Edgar] You, sir- I entertain you for one of my hundred; only I do not like the fashion of your garments. You'll say they are Persian attire; but let them be chang'd.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Now, good my lord, lie here and rest awhile.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Make no noise, make no noise; draw the curtains. So, so, so. We'll go to supper i' th' morning. So, so, so.

speaker: Fool
turn_text: And I'll go to bed at noon.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Gloucester.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Come hither, friend. Where is the King my master?

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Here, sir; but trouble him not; his wits are gone.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Good friend, I prithee take him in thy arms. I have o'erheard a plot of death upon him. There is a litter ready; lay him in't And drive towards Dover, friend, where thou shalt meet Both welcome and protection. Take up thy master. If thou shouldst dally half an hour, his life, With thine, and all that offer to defend him, Stand in assured loss. Take up, take up! And follow me, that will to some provision Give thee quick conduct.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Oppressed nature sleeps. This rest might yet have balm'd thy broken senses, Which, if convenience will not allow, Stand in hard cure. [To the Fool] Come, help to bear thy master. Thou must not stay behind.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Come, come, away!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt [all but Edgar].

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: When we our betters see bearing our woes, We scarcely think our miseries our foes. Who alone suffers suffers most i' th' mind, Leaving free things and happy shows behind; But then the mind much sufferance doth o'er-skip When grief hath mates, and bearing fellowship. How light and portable my pain seems now, When that which makes me bend makes the King bow, He childed as I fathered! Tom, away! Mark the high noises, and thyself bewray When false opinion, whose wrong thought defiles thee, In thy just proof repeals and reconciles thee. What will hap more to-night, safe scape the King! Lurk, lurk.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: [Exit.]

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Cornwall, Regan, Goneril, [Edmund the] Bastard, and Servants.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: [to Goneril] Post speedily to my lord your husband, show him this letter. The army of France is landed.- Seek out the traitor Gloucester.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: [Exeunt some of the Servants.]

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Hang him instantly.

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: Pluck out his eyes.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Leave him to my displeasure. Edmund, keep you our sister company. The revenges we are bound to take upon your traitorous father are not fit for your beholding. Advise the Duke where you are going, to a most festinate preparation. We are bound to the like. Our posts shall be swift and intelligent betwixt us. Farewell, dear sister; farewell, my Lord of Gloucester.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter [Oswald the] Steward.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: How now? Where's the King?

speaker: Oswald
turn_text: My Lord of Gloucester hath convey'd him hence. Some five or six and thirty of his knights, Hot questrists after him, met him at gate; Who, with some other of the lord's dependants, Are gone with him towards Dover, where they boast To have well-armed friends.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Get horses for your mistress.

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: Farewell, sweet lord, and sister.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Edmund, farewell.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt Goneril, [Edmund, and Oswald].

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Go seek the traitor Gloucester, Pinion him like a thief, bring him before us.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: [Exeunt other Servants.]

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Though well we may not pass upon his life Without the form of justice, yet our power Shall do a court'sy to our wrath, which men May blame, but not control.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Gloucester, brought in by two or three.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Who's there? the traitor?

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Ingrateful fox! 'tis he.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Bind fast his corky arms.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: What mean, your Graces? Good my friends, consider You are my guests. Do me no foul play, friends.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Bind him, I say.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: [Servants bind him.]

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Hard, hard. O filthy traitor!

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Unmerciful lady as you are, I am none.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: To this chair bind him. Villain, thou shalt find-

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: [Regan plucks his beard.]

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: By the kind gods, 'tis most ignobly done To pluck me by the beard.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: So white, and such a traitor!

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Naughty lady, These hairs which thou dost ravish from my chin Will quicken, and accuse thee. I am your host. With robber's hands my hospitable favours You should not ruffle thus. What will you do?

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Come, sir, what letters had you late from France?

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Be simple-answer'd, for we know the truth.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: And what confederacy have you with the traitors Late footed in the kingdom?

speaker: Regan
turn_text: To whose hands have you sent the lunatic King? Speak.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: I have a letter guessingly set down, Which came from one that's of a neutral heart, And not from one oppos'd.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Cunning.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: And false.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Where hast thou sent the King?

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: To Dover.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Wherefore to Dover? Wast thou not charg'd at peril-

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Wherefore to Dover? Let him first answer that.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: I am tied to th' stake, and I must stand the course.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Wherefore to Dover, sir?

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Because I would not see thy cruel nails Pluck out his poor old eyes; nor thy fierce sister In his anointed flesh stick boarish fangs. The sea, with such a storm as his bare head In hell-black night endur'd, would have buoy'd up And quench'd the steeled fires. Yet, poor old heart, he holp the heavens to rain. If wolves had at thy gate howl'd that stern time, Thou shouldst have said, 'Good porter, turn the key.' All cruels else subscrib'd. But I shall see The winged vengeance overtake such children.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: See't shalt thou never. Fellows, hold the chair. Upon these eyes of thine I'll set my foot.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: He that will think to live till he be old, Give me some help!- O cruel! O ye gods!

speaker: Regan
turn_text: One side will mock another. Th' other too!

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: If you see vengeance-

speaker: 1. Serv.
turn_text: Hold your hand, my lord! I have serv'd you ever since I was a child; But better service have I never done you Than now to bid you hold.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: How now, you dog?

speaker: 1. Serv.
turn_text: If you did wear a beard upon your chin, I'ld shake it on this quarrel.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: What do you mean?

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: My villain! Draw and fight.

speaker: 1. Serv.
turn_text: Nay, then, come on, and take the chance of anger.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Give me thy sword. A peasant stand up thus? She takes a sword and runs at him behind.

speaker: 1. Serv.
turn_text: O, I am slain! My lord, you have one eye left To see some mischief on him. O!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: He dies.

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: Lest it see more, prevent it. Out, vile jelly! Where is thy lustre now?

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: All dark and comfortless! Where's my son Edmund? Edmund, enkindle all the sparks of nature To quit this horrid act.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Out, treacherous villain! Thou call'st on him that hates thee. It was he That made the overture of thy treasons to us; Who is too good to pity thee.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: O my follies! Then Edgar was abus'd. Kind gods, forgive me that, and prosper him!

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Go thrust him out at gates, and let him smell His way to Dover.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit [one] with Gloucester.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: How is't, my lord? How look you?

speaker: Cornwall
turn_text: I have receiv'd a hurt. Follow me, lady. Turn out that eyeless villain. Throw this slave Upon the dunghill. Regan, I bleed apace. Untimely comes this hurt. Give me your arm.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit [Cornwall, led by Regan].

speaker: 2. Serv.
turn_text: I'll never care what wickedness I do, If this man come to good.

speaker: 3. Serv.
turn_text: If she live long, And in the end meet the old course of death, Women will all turn monsters.

speaker: 2. Serv.
turn_text: Let's follow the old Earl, and get the bedlam To lead him where he would. His roguish madness Allows itself to anything.

speaker: 3. Serv.
turn_text: Go thou. I'll fetch some flax and whites of eggs To apply to his bleeding face. Now heaven help him!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Edgar.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Yet better thus, and known to be contemn'd, Than still contemn'd and flatter'd. To be worst, The lowest and most dejected thing of fortune, Stands still in esperance, lives not in fear. The lamentable change is from the best; The worst returns to laughter. Welcome then, Thou unsubstantial air that I embrace! The wretch that thou hast blown unto the worst Owes nothing to thy blasts.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Gloucester, led by an Old Man.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: But who comes here? My father, poorly led? World, world, O world! But that thy strange mutations make us hate thee, Life would not yield to age.

speaker: Old Man
turn_text: O my good lord, I have been your tenant, and your father's tenant, These fourscore years.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Away, get thee away! Good friend, be gone. Thy comforts can do me no good at all; Thee they may hurt.

speaker: Old Man
turn_text: You cannot see your way.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: I have no way, and therefore want no eyes; I stumbled when I saw. Full oft 'tis seen Our means secure us, and our mere defects Prove our commodities. Ah dear son Edgar, The food of thy abused father's wrath! Might I but live to see thee in my touch, I'ld say I had eyes again!

speaker: Old Man
turn_text: How now? Who's there?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: [aside] O gods! Who is't can say 'I am at the worst'? I am worse than e'er I was.

speaker: Old Man
turn_text: 'Tis poor mad Tom.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: [aside] And worse I may be yet. The worst is not So long as we can say 'This is the worst.'

speaker: Old Man
turn_text: Fellow, where goest?

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Is it a beggarman?

speaker: Old Man
turn_text: Madman and beggar too.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: He has some reason, else he could not beg. I' th' last night's storm I such a fellow saw, Which made me think a man a worm. My son Came then into my mind, and yet my mind Was then scarce friends with him. I have heard more since. As flies to wanton boys are we to th' gods. They kill us for their sport.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: [aside] How should this be? Bad is the trade that must play fool to sorrow, Ang'ring itself and others.- Bless thee, master!

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Is that the naked fellow?

speaker: Old Man
turn_text: Ay, my lord.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Then prithee get thee gone. If for my sake Thou wilt o'ertake us hence a mile or twain I' th' way toward Dover, do it for ancient love; And bring some covering for this naked soul, Who I'll entreat to lead me.

speaker: Old Man
turn_text: Alack, sir, he is mad!

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: 'Tis the time's plague when madmen lead the blind. Do as I bid thee, or rather do thy pleasure. Above the rest, be gone.

speaker: Old Man
turn_text: I'll bring him the best 'parel that I have, Come on't what will.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Sirrah naked fellow-

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Poor Tom's acold. [Aside] I cannot daub it further.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Come hither, fellow.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: [aside] And yet I must.- Bless thy sweet eyes, they bleed.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Know'st thou the way to Dover?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Both stile and gate, horseway and footpath. Poor Tom hath been scar'd out of his good wits. Bless thee, good man's son, from the foul fiend! Five fiends have been in poor Tom at once: of lust, as Obidicut; Hobbididence, prince of dumbness; Mahu, of stealing; Modo, of murder; Flibbertigibbet, of mopping and mowing, who since possesses chambermaids and waiting women. So, bless thee, master!

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Here, take this purse, thou whom the heavens' plagues Have humbled to all strokes. That I am wretched Makes thee the happier. Heavens, deal so still! Let the superfluous and lust-dieted man, That slaves your ordinance, that will not see Because he does not feel, feel your pow'r quickly; So distribution should undo excess, And each man have enough. Dost thou know Dover?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Ay, master.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: There is a cliff, whose high and bending head Looks fearfully in the confined deep. Bring me but to the very brim of it, And I'll repair the misery thou dost bear With something rich about me. From that place I shall no leading need.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Give me thy arm. Poor Tom shall lead thee.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Goneril and [Edmund the] Bastard.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Goneril
turn_text: Welcome, my lord. I marvel our mild husband Not met us on the way.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter [Oswald the] Steward.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Goneril
turn_text: Now, where's your master?

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Oswald
turn_text: Madam, within, but never man so chang'd. I told him of the army that was landed: He smil'd at it. I told him you were coming: His answer was, 'The worse.' Of Gloucester's treachery And of the loyal service of his son When I inform'd him, then he call'd me sot And told me I had turn'd the wrong side out. What most he should dislike seems pleasant to him; What like, offensive.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Goneril
turn_text: [to Edmund] Then shall you go no further. It is the cowish terror of his spirit, That dares not undertake. He'll not feel wrongs Which tie him to an answer. Our wishes on the way May prove effects. Back, Edmund, to my brother. Hasten his musters and conduct his pow'rs. I must change arms at home and give the distaff Into my husband's hands. This trusty servant Shall pass between us. Ere long you are like to hear (If you dare venture in your own behalf) A mistress's command. Wear this. [Gives a favour.] Spare speech. Decline your head. This kiss, if it durst speak, Would stretch thy spirits up into the air. Conceive, and fare thee well.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Edmund
turn_text: Yours in the ranks of death!

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Goneril
turn_text: My most dear Gloucester! O, the difference of man and man! To thee a woman's services are due; My fool usurps my body.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Oswald
turn_text: Madam, here comes my lord.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Albany.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Goneril
turn_text: I have been worth the whistle.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Albany
turn_text: O Goneril, You are not worth the dust which the rude wind Blows in your face! I fear your disposition. That nature which contemns it origin Cannot be bordered certain in itself. She that herself will sliver and disbranch From her material sap, perforce must wither And come to deadly use.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Goneril
turn_text: No more! The text is foolish.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Albany
turn_text: Wisdom and goodness to the vile seem vile; Filths savour but themselves. What have you done? Tigers, not daughters, what have you perform'd? A father, and a gracious aged man, Whose reverence even the head-lugg'd bear would lick, Most barbarous, most degenerate, have you madded. Could my good brother suffer you to do it? A man, a prince, by him so benefited! If that the heavens do not their visible spirits Send quickly down to tame these vile offences, It will come, Humanity must perforce prey on itself, Like monsters of the deep.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Goneril
turn_text: Milk-liver'd man! That bear'st a cheek for blows, a head for wrongs; Who hast not in thy brows an eye discerning Thine honour from thy suffering; that not know'st Fools do those villains pity who are punish'd Ere they have done their mischief. Where's thy drum? France spreads his banners in our noiseless land, With plumed helm thy state begins to threat, Whiles thou, a moral fool, sit'st still, and criest 'Alack, why does he so?'

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Albany
turn_text: See thyself, devil! Proper deformity seems not in the fiend So horrid as in woman.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Goneril
turn_text: O vain fool!

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Albany
turn_text: Thou changed and self-cover'd thing, for shame! Bemonster not thy feature! Were't my fitness To let these hands obey my blood, They are apt enough to dislocate and tear Thy flesh and bones. Howe'er thou art a fiend, A woman's shape doth shield thee.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Goneril
turn_text: Marry, your manhood mew!

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter a Gentleman.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Albany
turn_text: What news?

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: O, my good lord, the Duke of Cornwall 's dead, Slain by his servant, going to put out The other eye of Gloucester.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Albany
turn_text: Gloucester's eyes?

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: A servant that he bred, thrill'd with remorse, Oppos'd against the act, bending his sword To his great master; who, thereat enrag'd, Flew on him, and amongst them fell'd him dead; But not without that harmful stroke which since Hath pluck'd him after.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Albany
turn_text: This shows you are above, You justicers, that these our nether crimes So speedily can venge! But O poor Gloucester! Lose he his other eye?

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Both, both, my lord. This letter, madam, craves a speedy answer. 'Tis from your sister.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Goneril
turn_text: [aside] One way I like this well; But being widow, and my Gloucester with her, May all the building in my fancy pluck Upon my hateful life. Another way The news is not so tart.- I'll read, and answer.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Albany
turn_text: Where was his son when they did take his eyes?

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Come with my lady hither.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Albany
turn_text: He is not here.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: No, my good lord; I met him back again.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Albany
turn_text: Knows he the wickedness?

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Ay, my good lord. 'Twas he inform'd against him, And quit the house on purpose, that their punishment Might have the freer course.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: Albany
turn_text: Gloucester, I live To thank thee for the love thou show'dst the King, And to revenge thine eyes. Come hither, friend. Tell me what more thou know'st.

location: Before the Duke of Albany's Palace
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Kent and a Gentleman.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Why the King of France is so suddenly gone back know you the reason?

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Something he left imperfect in the state, which since his coming forth is thought of, which imports to the kingdom so much fear and danger that his personal return was most required and necessary.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Who hath he left behind him general?

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: The Marshal of France, Monsieur La Far.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Did your letters pierce the Queen to any demonstration of grief?

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Ay, sir. She took them, read them in my presence, And now and then an ample tear trill'd down Her delicate cheek. It seem'd she was a queen Over her passion, who, most rebel-like, Sought to be king o'er her.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: O, then it mov'd her?

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Not to a rage. Patience and sorrow strove Who should express her goodliest. You have seen Sunshine and rain at once: her smiles and tears Were like, a better way. Those happy smilets That play'd on her ripe lip seem'd not to know What guests were in her eyes, which parted thence As pearls from diamonds dropp'd. In brief, Sorrow would be a rarity most belov'd, If all could so become it.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Made she no verbal question?

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Faith, once or twice she heav'd the name of father Pantingly forth, as if it press'd her heart; Cried 'Sisters, sisters! Shame of ladies! Sisters! Kent! father! sisters! What, i' th' storm? i' th' night? Let pity not be believ'd!' There she shook The holy water from her heavenly eyes, And clamour moisten'd. Then away she started To deal with grief alone.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: It is the stars, The stars above us, govern our conditions; Else one self mate and mate could not beget Such different issues. You spoke not with her since?

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: No.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Was this before the King return'd?

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: No, since.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Well, sir, the poor distressed Lear's i' th' town; Who sometime, in his better tune, remembers What we are come about, and by no means Will yield to see his daughter.

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Why, good sir?

speaker: Kent
turn_text: A sovereign shame so elbows him; his own unkindness, That stripp'd her from his benediction, turn'd her To foreign casualties, gave her dear rights To his dog-hearted daughters- these things sting His mind so venomously that burning shame Detains him from Cordelia.

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Alack, poor gentleman!

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Of Albany's and Cornwall's powers you heard not?

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: 'Tis so; they are afoot.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Well, sir, I'll bring you to our master Lear And leave you to attend him. Some dear cause Will in concealment wrap me up awhile. When I am known aright, you shall not grieve Lending me this acquaintance. I pray you go Along with me.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter, with Drum and Colours, Cordelia, Doctor, and Soldiers.

speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: Alack, 'tis he! Why, he was met even now As mad as the vex'd sea, singing aloud, Crown'd with rank fumiter and furrow weeds, With hardocks, hemlock, nettles, cuckoo flow'rs, Darnel, and all the idle weeds that grow In our sustaining corn. A century send forth. Search every acre in the high-grown field And bring him to our eye. [Exit an Officer.] What can man's wisdom In the restoring his bereaved sense? He that helps him take all my outward worth.

speaker: Doctor
turn_text: There is means, madam. Our foster nurse of nature is repose, The which he lacks. That to provoke in him Are many simples operative, whose power Will close the eye of anguish.

speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: All blest secrets, All you unpublish'd virtues of the earth, Spring with my tears! be aidant and remediate In the good man's distress! Seek, seek for him! Lest his ungovern'd rage dissolve the life That wants the means to lead it.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Messenger.

speaker: Messenger
turn_text: News, madam. The British pow'rs are marching hitherward.

speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: 'Tis known before. Our preparation stands In expectation of them. O dear father, It is thy business that I go about. Therefore great France My mourning and important tears hath pitied. No blown ambition doth our arms incite, But love, dear love, and our ag'd father's right. Soon may I hear and see him!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Regan and [Oswald the] Steward.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: But are my brother's pow'rs set forth?

speaker: Oswald
turn_text: Ay, madam.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Himself in person there?

speaker: Oswald
turn_text: Madam, with much ado. Your sister is the better soldier.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Lord Edmund spake not with your lord at home?

speaker: Oswald
turn_text: No, madam.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: What might import my sister's letter to him?

speaker: Oswald
turn_text: I know not, lady.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Faith, he is posted hence on serious matter. It was great ignorance, Gloucester's eyes being out, To let him live. Where he arrives he moves All hearts against us. Edmund, I think, is gone, In pity of his misery, to dispatch His nighted life; moreover, to descry The strength o' th' enemy.

speaker: Oswald
turn_text: I must needs after him, madam, with my letter.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Our troops set forth to-morrow. Stay with us. The ways are dangerous.

speaker: Oswald
turn_text: I may not, madam. My lady charg'd my duty in this business.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Why should she write to Edmund? Might not you Transport her purposes by word? Belike, Something- I know not what- I'll love thee much- Let me unseal the letter.

speaker: Oswald
turn_text: Madam, I had rather-

speaker: Regan
turn_text: I know your lady does not love her husband; I am sure of that; and at her late being here She gave strange eliads and most speaking looks To noble Edmund. I know you are of her bosom.

speaker: Oswald
turn_text: I, madam?

speaker: Regan
turn_text: I speak in understanding. Y'are! I know't. Therefore I do advise you take this note. My lord is dead; Edmund and I have talk'd, And more convenient is he for my hand Than for your lady's. You may gather more. If you do find him, pray you give him this; And when your mistress hears thus much from you, I pray desire her call her wisdom to her. So farewell. If you do chance to hear of that blind traitor, Preferment falls on him that cuts him off.

speaker: Oswald
turn_text: Would I could meet him, madam! I should show What party I do follow.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Fare thee well.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Gloucester, and Edgar [like a Peasant].

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: When shall I come to th' top of that same hill?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: You do climb up it now. Look how we labour.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Methinks the ground is even.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Horrible steep. Hark, do you hear the sea?

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: No, truly.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Why, then, your other senses grow imperfect By your eyes' anguish.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: So may it be indeed. Methinks thy voice is alter'd, and thou speak'st In better phrase and matter than thou didst.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Y'are much deceiv'd. In nothing am I chang'd But in my garments.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Methinks y'are better spoken.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Come on, sir; here's the place. Stand still. How fearful And dizzy 'tis to cast one's eyes so low! The crows and choughs that wing the midway air Show scarce so gross as beetles. Halfway down Hangs one that gathers sampire- dreadful trade! Methinks he seems no bigger than his head. The fishermen that walk upon the beach Appear like mice; and yond tall anchoring bark, Diminish'd to her cock; her cock, a buoy Almost too small for sight. The murmuring surge That on th' unnumb'red idle pebble chafes Cannot be heard so high. I'll look no more, Lest my brain turn, and the deficient sight Topple down headlong.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Set me where you stand.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Give me your hand. You are now within a foot Of th' extreme verge. For all beneath the moon Would I not leap upright.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Let go my hand. Here, friend, is another purse; in it a jewel Well worth a poor man's taking. Fairies and gods Prosper it with thee! Go thou further off; Bid me farewell, and let me hear thee going.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Now fare ye well, good sir.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: With all my heart.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: [aside] Why I do trifle thus with his despair Is done to cure it.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: O you mighty gods! [He kneels.] This world I do renounce, and, in your sights, Shake patiently my great affliction off. If I could bear it longer and not fall To quarrel with your great opposeless wills, My snuff and loathed part of nature should Burn itself out. If Edgar live, O, bless him! Now, fellow, fare thee well.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: He falls [forward and swoons].

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Gone, sir, farewell.- And yet I know not how conceit may rob The treasury of life when life itself Yields to the theft. Had he been where he thought, By this had thought been past.- Alive or dead? Ho you, sir! friend! Hear you, sir? Speak!- Thus might he pass indeed. Yet he revives.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: What are you, sir?

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Away, and let me die.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Hadst thou been aught but gossamer, feathers, air, So many fadom down precipitating, Thou'dst shiver'd like an egg; but thou dost breathe; Hast heavy substance; bleed'st not; speak'st; art sound. Ten masts at each make not the altitude Which thou hast perpendicularly fell. Thy life is a miracle. Speak yet again.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: But have I fall'n, or no?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: From the dread summit of this chalky bourn. Look up a-height. The shrill-gorg'd lark so far Cannot be seen or heard. Do but look up.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Alack, I have no eyes! Is wretchedness depriv'd that benefit To end itself by death? 'Twas yet some comfort When misery could beguile the tyrant's rage And frustrate his proud will.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Give me your arm. Up- so. How is't? Feel you your legs? You stand.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Too well, too well.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: This is above all strangeness. Upon the crown o' th' cliff what thing was that Which parted from you?

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: A poor unfortunate beggar.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: As I stood here below, methought his eyes Were two full moons; he had a thousand noses, Horns whelk'd and wav'd like the enridged sea. It was some fiend. Therefore, thou happy father, Think that the clearest gods, who make them honours Of men's impossibility, have preserv'd thee.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: I do remember now. Henceforth I'll bear Affliction till it do cry out itself 'Enough, enough,' and die. That thing you speak of, I took it for a man. Often 'twould say 'The fiend, the fiend'- he led me to that place.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Bear free and patient thoughts.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Lear, mad, [fantastically dressed with weeds].

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: But who comes here? The safer sense will ne'er accommodate His master thus.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: No, they cannot touch me for coming; I am the King himself.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: O thou side-piercing sight!

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Nature 's above art in that respect. There's your press money. That fellow handles his bow like a crow-keeper. Draw me a clothier's yard. Look, look, a mouse! Peace, peace; this piece of toasted cheese will do't. There's my gauntlet; I'll prove it on a giant. Bring up the brown bills. O, well flown, bird! i' th' clout, i' th' clout! Hewgh! Give the word.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Sweet marjoram.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Pass.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: I know that voice.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Ha! Goneril with a white beard? They flatter'd me like a dog, and told me I had white hairs in my beard ere the black ones were there. To say 'ay' and 'no' to everything I said! 'Ay' and 'no' too was no good divinity. When the rain came to wet me once, and the wind to make me chatter; when the thunder would not peace at my bidding; there I found 'em, there I smelt 'em out. Go to, they are not men o' their words! They told me I was everything. 'Tis a lie- I am not ague-proof.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: The trick of that voice I do well remember. Is't not the King?

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Ay, every inch a king! When I do stare, see how the subject quakes. I pardon that man's life. What was thy cause? Adultery? Thou shalt not die. Die for adultery? No. The wren goes to't, and the small gilded fly Does lecher in my sight. Let copulation thrive; for Gloucester's bastard son Was kinder to his father than my daughters Got 'tween the lawful sheets. To't, luxury, pell-mell! for I lack soldiers. Behold yond simp'ring dame, Whose face between her forks presageth snow, That minces virtue, and does shake the head To hear of pleasure's name. The fitchew nor the soiled horse goes to't With a more riotous appetite. Down from the waist they are Centaurs, Though women all above. But to the girdle do the gods inherit, Beneath is all the fiend's. There's hell, there's darkness, there's the sulphurous pit; burning, scalding, stench, consumption. Fie, fie, fie! pah, pah! Give me an ounce of civet, good apothecary, to sweeten my imagination. There's money for thee.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: O, let me kiss that hand!

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Let me wipe it first; it smells of mortality.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: O ruin'd piece of nature! This great world Shall so wear out to naught. Dost thou know me?

speaker: Lear
turn_text: I remember thine eyes well enough. Dost thou squiny at me? No, do thy worst, blind Cupid! I'll not love. Read thou this challenge; mark but the penning of it.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Were all the letters suns, I could not see one.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: [aside] I would not take this from report. It is, And my heart breaks at it.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Read.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: What, with the case of eyes?

speaker: Lear
turn_text: O, ho, are you there with me? No eyes in your head, nor no money in your purse? Your eyes are in a heavy case, your purse in a light. Yet you see how this world goes.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: I see it feelingly.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: What, art mad? A man may see how the world goes with no eyes. Look with thine ears. See how yond justice rails upon yond simple thief. Hark in thine ear. Change places and, handy-dandy, which is the justice, which is the thief? Thou hast seen a farmer's dog bark at a beggar?

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Ay, sir.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: And the creature run from the cur? There thou mightst behold the great image of authority: a dog's obeyed in office. Thou rascal beadle, hold thy bloody hand! Why dost thou lash that whore? Strip thine own back. Thou hotly lusts to use her in that kind For which thou whip'st her. The usurer hangs the cozener. Through tatter'd clothes small vices do appear; Robes and furr'd gowns hide all. Plate sin with gold, And the strong lance of justice hurtless breaks; Arm it in rags, a pygmy's straw does pierce it. None does offend, none- I say none! I'll able 'em. Take that of me, my friend, who have the power To seal th' accuser's lips. Get thee glass eyes And, like a scurvy politician, seem To see the things thou dost not. Now, now, now, now! Pull off my boots. Harder, harder! So.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: O, matter and impertinency mix'd! Reason, in madness!

speaker: Lear
turn_text: If thou wilt weep my fortunes, take my eyes. I know thee well enough; thy name is Gloucester. Thou must be patient. We came crying hither; Thou know'st, the first time that we smell the air We wawl and cry. I will preach to thee. Mark.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Alack, alack the day!

speaker: Lear
turn_text: When we are born, we cry that we are come To this great stage of fools. This' a good block. It were a delicate stratagem to shoe A troop of horse with felt. I'll put't in proof, And when I have stol'n upon these sons-in-law, Then kill, kill, kill, kill, kill, kill!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter a Gentleman [with Attendants].

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: O, here he is! Lay hand upon him.- Sir, Your most dear daughter-

speaker: Lear
turn_text: No rescue? What, a prisoner? I am even The natural fool of fortune. Use me well; You shall have ransom. Let me have a surgeon; I am cut to th' brains.

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: You shall have anything.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: No seconds? All myself? Why, this would make a man a man of salt, To use his eyes for garden waterpots, Ay, and laying autumn's dust.

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Good sir-

speaker: Lear
turn_text: I will die bravely, like a smug bridegroom. What! I will be jovial. Come, come, I am a king; My masters, know you that?

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: You are a royal one, and we obey you.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Then there's life in't. Nay, an you get it, you shall get it by running. Sa, sa, sa, sa!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit running. [Attendants follow.]

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: A sight most pitiful in the meanest wretch, Past speaking of in a king! Thou hast one daughter Who redeems nature from the general curse Which twain have brought her to.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Hail, gentle sir.

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Sir, speed you. What's your will?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Do you hear aught, sir, of a battle toward?

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Most sure and vulgar. Every one hears that Which can distinguish sound.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: But, by your favour, How near's the other army?

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Near and on speedy foot. The main descry Stands on the hourly thought.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: I thank you sir. That's all.

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Though that the Queen on special cause is here, Her army is mov'd on.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: I thank you, sir

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit [Gentleman].

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: You ever-gentle gods, take my breath from me; Let not my worser spirit tempt me again To die before you please!

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Well pray you, father.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Now, good sir, what are you?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: A most poor man, made tame to fortune's blows, Who, by the art of known and feeling sorrows, Am pregnant to good pity. Give me your hand; I'll lead you to some biding.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Hearty thanks. The bounty and the benison of heaven To boot, and boot!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter [Oswald the] Steward.

speaker: Oswald
turn_text: A proclaim'd prize! Most happy! That eyeless head of thine was first fram'd flesh To raise my fortunes. Thou old unhappy traitor, Briefly thyself remember. The sword is out That must destroy thee.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Now let thy friendly hand Put strength enough to't.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: [Edgar interposes.]

speaker: Oswald
turn_text: Wherefore, bold peasant, Dar'st thou support a publish'd traitor? Hence! Lest that th' infection of his fortune take Like hold on thee. Let go his arm.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Chill not let go, zir, without vurther 'cagion.

speaker: Oswald
turn_text: Let go, slave, or thou diest!

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Good gentleman, go your gait, and let poor voke pass. An chud ha' bin zwagger'd out of my life, 'twould not ha' bin zo long as 'tis by a vortnight. Nay, come not near th' old man. Keep out, che vore ye, or Ise try whether your costard or my ballow be the harder. Chill be plain with you.

speaker: Oswald
turn_text: Out, dunghill!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: They fight.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Chill pick your teeth, zir. Come! No matter vor your foins.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: [Oswald falls.]

speaker: Oswald
turn_text: Slave, thou hast slain me. Villain, take my purse. If ever thou wilt thrive, bury my body, And give the letters which thou find'st about me To Edmund Earl of Gloucester. Seek him out Upon the British party. O, untimely death! Death!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: He dies.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: I know thee well. A serviceable villain, As duteous to the vices of thy mistress As badness would desire.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: What, is he dead?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Sit you down, father; rest you. Let's see his pockets; these letters that he speaks of May be my friends. He's dead. I am only sorry He had no other deathsman. Let us see. Leave, gentle wax; and, manners, blame us not. To know our enemies' minds, we'ld rip their hearts; Their papers, is more lawful. [Reads the letter.] 'Let our reciprocal vows be rememb'red. You have many opportunities to cut him off. If your will want not, time and place will be fruitfully offer'd. There is nothing done, if he return the conqueror. Then am I the prisoner, and his bed my jail; from the loathed warmth whereof deliver me, and supply the place for your labour. Your (wife, so I would say) affectionate servant, Goneril.' O indistinguish'd space of woman's will! A plot upon her virtuous husband's life, And the exchange my brother! Here in the sands Thee I'll rake up, the post unsanctified Of murtherous lechers; and in the mature time With this ungracious paper strike the sight Of the death-practis'd Duke, For him 'tis well That of thy death and business I can tell.

speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: The King is mad. How stiff is my vile sense, That I stand up, and have ingenious feeling Of my huge sorrows! Better I were distract. So should my thoughts be sever'd from my griefs, And woes by wrong imaginations lose The knowledge of themselves.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: A drum afar off.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Give me your hand. Far off methinks I hear the beaten drum. Come, father, I'll bestow you with a friend.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Cordelia, Kent, Doctor, and Gentleman.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: O thou good Kent, how shall I live and work To match thy goodness? My life will be too short And every measure fail me.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Kent
turn_text: To be acknowledg'd, madam, is o'erpaid. All my reports go with the modest truth; Nor more nor clipp'd, but so.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: Be better suited. These weeds are memories of those worser hours. I prithee put them off.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Kent
turn_text: Pardon, dear madam. Yet to be known shortens my made intent. My boon I make it that you know me not Till time and I think meet.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: Then be't so, my good lord. [To the Doctor] How, does the King?

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Doctor
turn_text: Madam, sleeps still.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: O you kind gods, Cure this great breach in his abused nature! Th' untun'd and jarring senses, O, wind up Of this child-changed father!

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Doctor
turn_text: So please your Majesty That we may wake the King? He hath slept long.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: Be govern'd by your knowledge, and proceed I' th' sway of your own will. Is he array'd?

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Lear in a chair carried by Servants.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Ay, madam. In the heaviness of sleep We put fresh garments on him.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Doctor
turn_text: Be by, good madam, when we do awake him. I doubt not of his temperance.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: Very well.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Music.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Doctor
turn_text: Please you draw near. Louder the music there!

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: O my dear father, restoration hang Thy medicine on my lips, and let this kiss Repair those violent harms that my two sisters Have in thy reverence made!

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Kent
turn_text: Kind and dear princess!

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: Had you not been their father, these white flakes Had challeng'd pity of them. Was this a face To be oppos'd against the warring winds? To stand against the deep dread-bolted thunder? In the most terrible and nimble stroke Of quick cross lightning? to watch- poor perdu!- With this thin helm? Mine enemy's dog, Though he had bit me, should have stood that night Against my fire; and wast thou fain, poor father, To hovel thee with swine and rogues forlorn, In short and musty straw? Alack, alack! 'Tis wonder that thy life and wits at once Had not concluded all.- He wakes. Speak to him.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Doctor
turn_text: Madam, do you; 'tis fittest.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: How does my royal lord? How fares your Majesty?

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Lear
turn_text: You do me wrong to take me out o' th' grave. Thou art a soul in bliss; but I am bound Upon a wheel of fire, that mine own tears Do scald like molten lead.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: Sir, do you know me?

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Lear
turn_text: You are a spirit, I know. When did you die?

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: Still, still, far wide!

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Doctor
turn_text: He's scarce awake. Let him alone awhile.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Lear
turn_text: Where have I been? Where am I? Fair daylight, I am mightily abus'd. I should e'en die with pity, To see another thus. I know not what to say. I will not swear these are my hands. Let's see. I feel this pin prick. Would I were assur'd Of my condition!

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: O, look upon me, sir, And hold your hands in benediction o'er me. No, sir, you must not kneel.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Lear
turn_text: Pray, do not mock me. I am a very foolish fond old man, Fourscore and upward, not an hour more nor less; And, to deal plainly, I fear I am not in my perfect mind. Methinks I should know you, and know this man; Yet I am doubtful; for I am mainly ignorant What place this is; and all the skill I have Remembers not these garments; nor I know not Where I did lodge last night. Do not laugh at me; For (as I am a man) I think this lady To be my child Cordelia.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: And so I am! I am!

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Lear
turn_text: Be your tears wet? Yes, faith. I pray weep not. If you have poison for me, I will drink it. I know you do not love me; for your sisters Have, as I do remember, done me wrong. You have some cause, they have not.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: No cause, no cause.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Lear
turn_text: Am I in France?

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Kent
turn_text: In your own kingdom, sir.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Lear
turn_text: Do not abuse me.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Doctor
turn_text: Be comforted, good madam. The great rage You see is kill'd in him; and yet it is danger To make him even o'er the time he has lost. Desire him to go in. Trouble him no more Till further settling.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: Will't please your Highness walk?

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Lear
turn_text: You must bear with me. Pray you now, forget and forgive. I am old and foolish.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt. Manent Kent and Gentleman.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Holds it true, sir, that the Duke of Cornwall was so slain?

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Kent
turn_text: Most certain, sir.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Gentleman
