turn_text: Who is conductor of his people?

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Kent
turn_text: As 'tis said, the bastard son of Gloucester.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: They say Edgar, his banish'd son, is with the Earl of Kent in Germany.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Kent
turn_text: Report is changeable. 'Tis time to look about; the powers of the kingdom approach apace.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: The arbitrement is like to be bloody. Fare you well, sir.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: [Exit.]

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: Kent
turn_text: My point and period will be throughly wrought, Or well or ill, as this day's battle's fought.

location: A tent in the French camp
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter, with Drum and Colours, Edmund, Regan, Gentleman, and Soldiers.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: Know of the Duke if his last purpose hold, Or whether since he is advis'd by aught To change the course. He's full of alteration And self-reproving. Bring his constant pleasure.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: [Exit an Officer.]

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Our sister's man is certainly miscarried.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: Tis to be doubted, madam.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Now, sweet lord, You know the goodness I intend upon you. Tell me- but truly- but then speak the truth- Do you not love my sister?

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: In honour'd love.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: But have you never found my brother's way To the forfended place?

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: That thought abuses you.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: I am doubtful that you have been conjunct And bosom'd with her, as far as we call hers.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: No, by mine honour, madam.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: I never shall endure her. Dear my lord, Be not familiar with her.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: Fear me not. She and the Duke her husband!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter, with Drum and Colours, Albany, Goneril, Soldiers.

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: [aside] I had rather lose the battle than that sister Should loosen him and me.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Our very loving sister, well bemet. Sir, this I hear: the King is come to his daughter, With others whom the rigour of our state Forc'd to cry out. Where I could not be honest, I never yet was valiant. For this business, It toucheth us as France invades our land, Not bolds the King, with others whom, I fear, Most just and heavy causes make oppose.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: Sir, you speak nobly.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Why is this reason'd?

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: Combine together 'gainst the enemy; For these domestic and particular broils Are not the question here.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Let's then determine With th' ancient of war on our proceeding.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: I shall attend you presently at your tent.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Sister, you'll go with us?

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: No.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: 'Tis most convenient. Pray you go with us.

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: [aside] O, ho, I know the riddle.- I will go.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: [As they are going out,] enter Edgar [disguised].

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: If e'er your Grace had speech with man so poor, Hear me one word.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: I'll overtake you.- Speak.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt [all but Albany and Edgar].

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Before you fight the battle, ope this letter. If you have victory, let the trumpet sound For him that brought it. Wretched though I seem, I can produce a champion that will prove What is avouched there. If you miscarry, Your business of the world hath so an end, And machination ceases. Fortune love you!

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Stay till I have read the letter.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: I was forbid it. When time shall serve, let but the herald cry, And I'll appear again.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Why, fare thee well. I will o'erlook thy paper.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit [Edgar].

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Edmund.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: The enemy 's in view; draw up your powers. Here is the guess of their true strength and forces By diligent discovery; but your haste Is now urg'd on you.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: We will greet the time.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: To both these sisters have I sworn my love; Each jealous of the other, as the stung Are of the adder. Which of them shall I take? Both? one? or neither? Neither can be enjoy'd, If both remain alive. To take the widow Exasperates, makes mad her sister Goneril; And hardly shall I carry out my side, Her husband being alive. Now then, we'll use His countenance for the battle, which being done, Let her who would be rid of him devise His speedy taking off. As for the mercy Which he intends to Lear and to Cordelia- The battle done, and they within our power, Shall never see his pardon; for my state Stands on me to defend, not to debate.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit.

location: A field between the two camps
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Alarum within. Enter, with Drum and Colours, the Powers of France over the stage, Cordelia with her Father in her hand, and exeunt.

location: A field between the two camps
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Edgar and Gloucester.

location: A field between the two camps
speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Here, father, take the shadow of this tree For your good host. Pray that the right may thrive. If ever I return to you again, I'll bring you comfort.

location: A field between the two camps
speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: Grace go with you, sir!

location: A field between the two camps
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit [Edgar].

location: A field between the two camps
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Alarum and retreat within. Enter Edgar.

location: A field between the two camps
speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Away, old man! give me thy hand! away! King Lear hath lost, he and his daughter ta'en. Give me thy hand! come on!

location: A field between the two camps
speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: No further, sir. A man may rot even here.

location: A field between the two camps
speaker: Edgar
turn_text: What, in ill thoughts again? Men must endure Their going hence, even as their coming hither; Ripeness is all. Come on.

location: A field between the two camps
speaker: Gloucester
turn_text: And that's true too.

location: A field between the two camps
speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter, in conquest, with Drum and Colours, Edmund; Lear and Cordelia as prisoners; Soldiers, Captain.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: Some officers take them away. Good guard Until their greater pleasures first be known That are to censure them.

speaker: Cordelia
turn_text: We are not the first Who with best meaning have incurr'd the worst. For thee, oppressed king, am I cast down; Myself could else outfrown false Fortune's frown. Shall we not see these daughters and these sisters?

speaker: Lear
turn_text: No, no, no, no! Come, let's away to prison. We two alone will sing like birds i' th' cage. When thou dost ask me blessing, I'll kneel down And ask of thee forgiveness. So we'll live, And pray, and sing, and tell old tales, and laugh At gilded butterflies, and hear poor rogues Talk of court news; and we'll talk with them too- Who loses and who wins; who's in, who's out- And take upon 's the mystery of things, As if we were God's spies; and we'll wear out, In a wall'd prison, packs and sects of great ones That ebb and flow by th' moon.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: Take them away.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Upon such sacrifices, my Cordelia, The gods themselves throw incense. Have I caught thee? He that parts us shall bring a brand from heaven And fire us hence like foxes. Wipe thine eyes. The goodyears shall devour 'em, flesh and fell, Ere they shall make us weep! We'll see 'em starv'd first. Come.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt [Lear and Cordelia, guarded].

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: Come hither, Captain; hark. Take thou this note [gives a paper]. Go follow them to prison. One step I have advanc'd thee. If thou dost As this instructs thee, thou dost make thy way To noble fortunes. Know thou this, that men Are as the time is. To be tender-minded Does not become a sword. Thy great employment Will not bear question. Either say thou'lt do't, Or thrive by other means.

speaker: Captain
turn_text: I'll do't, my lord.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: About it! and write happy when th' hast done. Mark- I say, instantly; and carry it so As I have set it down.

speaker: Captain
turn_text: I cannot draw a cart, nor eat dried oats; If it be man's work, I'll do't.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Flourish. Enter Albany, Goneril, Regan, Soldiers.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Sir, you have show'd to-day your valiant strain, And fortune led you well. You have the captives Who were the opposites of this day's strife. We do require them of you, so to use them As we shall find their merits and our safety May equally determine.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: Sir, I thought it fit To send the old and miserable King To some retention and appointed guard; Whose age has charms in it, whose title more, To pluck the common bosom on his side And turn our impress'd lances in our eyes Which do command them. With him I sent the Queen, My reason all the same; and they are ready To-morrow, or at further space, t' appear Where you shall hold your session. At this time We sweat and bleed: the friend hath lost his friend; And the best quarrels, in the heat, are curs'd By those that feel their sharpness. The question of Cordelia and her father Requires a fitter place.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Sir, by your patience, I hold you but a subject of this war, Not as a brother.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: That's as we list to grace him. Methinks our pleasure might have been demanded Ere you had spoke so far. He led our powers, Bore the commission of my place and person, The which immediacy may well stand up And call itself your brother.

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: Not so hot! In his own grace he doth exalt himself More than in your addition.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: In my rights By me invested, he compeers the best.

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: That were the most if he should husband you.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Jesters do oft prove prophets.

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: Holla, holla! That eye that told you so look'd but asquint.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Lady, I am not well; else I should answer From a full-flowing stomach. General, Take thou my soldiers, prisoners, patrimony; Dispose of them, of me; the walls are thine. Witness the world that I create thee here My lord and master.

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: Mean you to enjoy him?

speaker: Albany
turn_text: The let-alone lies not in your good will.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: Nor in thine, lord.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Half-blooded fellow, yes.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: [to Edmund] Let the drum strike, and prove my title thine.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Stay yet; hear reason. Edmund, I arrest thee On capital treason; and, in thine attaint, This gilded serpent [points to Goneril]. For your claim, fair sister, I bar it in the interest of my wife. 'Tis she is subcontracted to this lord, And I, her husband, contradict your banes. If you will marry, make your loves to me; My lady is bespoke.

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: An interlude!

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Thou art arm'd, Gloucester. Let the trumpet sound. If none appear to prove upon thy person Thy heinous, manifest, and many treasons, There is my pledge [throws down a glove]! I'll prove it on thy heart, Ere I taste bread, thou art in nothing less Than I have here proclaim'd thee.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: Sick, O, sick!

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: [aside] If not, I'll ne'er trust medicine.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: There's my exchange [throws down a glove]. What in the world he is That names me traitor, villain-like he lies. Call by thy trumpet. He that dares approach, On him, on you, who not? I will maintain My truth and honour firmly.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: A herald, ho!

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: A herald, ho, a herald!

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Trust to thy single virtue; for thy soldiers, All levied in my name, have in my name Took their discharge.

speaker: Regan
turn_text: My sickness grows upon me.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: She is not well. Convey her to my tent.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: [Exit Regan, led.]

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter a Herald.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Come hither, herald. Let the trumpet sound, And read out this.

speaker: Captain
turn_text: Sound, trumpet!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: A trumpet sounds.

speaker: Herald
turn_text: (reads) 'If any man of quality or degree within the lists of the army will maintain upon Edmund, supposed Earl of Gloucester, that he is a manifold traitor, let him appear by the third sound of the trumpet. He is bold in his defence.'

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: Sound!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: First trumpet.

speaker: Herald
turn_text: Again!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Second trumpet.

speaker: Herald
turn_text: Again!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Third trumpet. Trumpet answers within.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Edgar, armed, at the third sound, a Trumpet before him.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Ask him his purposes, why he appears Upon this call o' th' trumpet.

speaker: Herald
turn_text: What are you? Your name, your quality? and why you answer This present summons?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Know my name is lost; By treason's tooth bare-gnawn and canker-bit. Yet am I noble as the adversary I come to cope.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Which is that adversary?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: What's he that speaks for Edmund Earl of Gloucester?

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: Himself. What say'st thou to him?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Draw thy sword, That, if my speech offend a noble heart, Thy arm may do thee justice. Here is mine. Behold, it is the privilege of mine honours, My oath, and my profession. I protest- Maugre thy strength, youth, place, and eminence, Despite thy victor sword and fire-new fortune, Thy valour and thy heart- thou art a traitor; False to thy gods, thy brother, and thy father; Conspirant 'gainst this high illustrious prince; And from th' extremest upward of thy head To the descent and dust beneath thy foot, A most toad-spotted traitor. Say thou 'no,' This sword, this arm, and my best spirits are bent To prove upon thy heart, whereto I speak, Thou liest.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: In wisdom I should ask thy name; But since thy outside looks so fair and warlike, And that thy tongue some say of breeding breathes, What safe and nicely I might well delay By rule of knighthood, I disdain and spurn. Back do I toss those treasons to thy head; With the hell-hated lie o'erwhelm thy heart; Which- for they yet glance by and scarcely bruise- This sword of mine shall give them instant way Where they shall rest for ever. Trumpets, speak!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Alarums. Fight. [Edmund falls.]

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Save him, save him!

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: This is mere practice, Gloucester. By th' law of arms thou wast not bound to answer An unknown opposite. Thou art not vanquish'd, But cozen'd and beguil'd.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Shut your mouth, dame, Or with this paper shall I stop it. [Shows her her letter to Edmund.]- [To Edmund]. Hold, sir. [To Goneril] Thou worse than any name, read thine own evil. No tearing, lady! I perceive you know it.

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: Say if I do- the laws are mine, not thine. Who can arraign me for't?

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Most monstrous! Know'st thou this paper?

speaker: Goneril
turn_text: Ask me not what I know.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exit.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Go after her. She's desperate; govern her.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: [Exit an Officer.]

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: What, you have charg'd me with, that have I done, And more, much more. The time will bring it out. 'Tis past, and so am I.- But what art thou That hast this fortune on me? If thou'rt noble, I do forgive thee.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Let's exchange charity. I am no less in blood than thou art, Edmund; If more, the more th' hast wrong'd me. My name is Edgar and thy father's son. The gods are just, and of our pleasant vices Make instruments to scourge us. The dark and vicious place where thee he got Cost him his eyes.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: Th' hast spoken right; 'tis true. The wheel is come full circle; I am here.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Methought thy very gait did prophesy A royal nobleness. I must embrace thee. Let sorrow split my heart if ever I Did hate thee, or thy father!

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Worthy prince, I know't.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Where have you hid yourself? How have you known the miseries of your father?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: By nursing them, my lord. List a brief tale; And when 'tis told, O that my heart would burst! The bloody proclamation to escape That follow'd me so near (O, our lives' sweetness! That with the pain of death would hourly die Rather than die at once!) taught me to shift Into a madman's rags, t' assume a semblance That very dogs disdain'd; and in this habit Met I my father with his bleeding rings, Their precious stones new lost; became his guide, Led him, begg'd for him, sav'd him from despair; Never (O fault!) reveal'd myself unto him Until some half hour past, when I was arm'd, Not sure, though hoping of this good success, I ask'd his blessing, and from first to last Told him my pilgrimage. But his flaw'd heart (Alack, too weak the conflict to support!) 'Twixt two extremes of passion, joy and grief, Burst smilingly.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: This speech of yours hath mov'd me, And shall perchance do good; but speak you on; You look as you had something more to say.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: If there be more, more woful, hold it in; For I am almost ready to dissolve, Hearing of this.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: This would have seem'd a period To such as love not sorrow; but another, To amplify too much, would make much more, And top extremity. Whilst I was big in clamour, came there a man, Who, having seen me in my worst estate, Shunn'd my abhorr'd society; but then, finding Who 'twas that so endur'd, with his strong arms He fastened on my neck, and bellowed out As he'd burst heaven; threw him on my father; Told the most piteous tale of Lear and him That ever ear receiv'd; which in recounting His grief grew puissant, and the strings of life Began to crack. Twice then the trumpets sounded, And there I left him tranc'd.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: But who was this?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Kent, sir, the banish'd Kent; who in disguise Followed his enemy king and did him service Improper for a slave.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter a Gentleman with a bloody knife.

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Help, help! O, help!

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: What kind of help?

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Speak, man.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: What means that bloody knife?

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: 'Tis hot, it smokes. It came even from the heart of- O! she's dead!

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Who dead? Speak, man.

speaker: Gentleman
turn_text: Your lady, sir, your lady! and her sister By her is poisoned; she hath confess'd it.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: I was contracted to them both. All three Now marry in an instant.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Kent.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Here comes Kent.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Produce their bodies, be they alive or dead.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: [Exit Gentleman.]

speaker: Albany
turn_text: This judgement of the heavens, that makes us tremble Touches us not with pity. O, is this he? The time will not allow the compliment That very manners urges.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: I am come To bid my king and master aye good night. Is he not here?

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Great thing of us forgot! Speak, Edmund, where's the King? and where's Cordelia?

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: The bodies of Goneril and Regan are brought in.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Seest thou this object, Kent?

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Alack, why thus?

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: Yet Edmund was belov'd. The one the other poisoned for my sake, And after slew herself.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Even so. Cover their faces.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: I pant for life. Some good I mean to do, Despite of mine own nature. Quickly send (Be brief in't) to the castle; for my writ Is on the life of Lear and on Cordelia. Nay, send in time.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Run, run, O, run!

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: To who, my lord? Who has the office? Send Thy token of reprieve.

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: Well thought on. Take my sword; Give it the Captain.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Haste thee for thy life.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: [Exit Edgar.]

speaker: Edmund
turn_text: He hath commission from thy wife and me To hang Cordelia in the prison and To lay the blame upon her own despair That she fordid herself.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: The gods defend her! Bear him hence awhile.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: [Edmund is borne off.]

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter Lear, with Cordelia [dead] in his arms, [Edgar, Captain, and others following].

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Howl, howl, howl, howl! O, you are men of stone. Had I your tongues and eyes, I'ld use them so That heaven's vault should crack. She's gone for ever! I know when one is dead, and when one lives. She's dead as earth. Lend me a looking glass. If that her breath will mist or stain the stone, Why, then she lives.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Is this the promis'd end?

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Or image of that horror?

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Fall and cease!

speaker: Lear
turn_text: This feather stirs; she lives! If it be so, It is a chance which does redeem all sorrows That ever I have felt.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: O my good master!

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Prithee away!

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: 'Tis noble Kent, your friend.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: A plague upon you, murderers, traitors all! I might have sav'd her; now she's gone for ever! Cordelia, Cordelia! stay a little. Ha! What is't thou say'st, Her voice was ever soft, Gentle, and low- an excellent thing in woman. I kill'd the slave that was a-hanging thee.

speaker: Captain
turn_text: 'Tis true, my lords, he did.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Did I not, fellow? I have seen the day, with my good biting falchion I would have made them skip. I am old now, And these same crosses spoil me. Who are you? Mine eyes are not o' th' best. I'll tell you straight.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: If fortune brag of two she lov'd and hated, One of them we behold.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: This' a dull sight. Are you not Kent?

speaker: Kent
turn_text: The same- Your servant Kent. Where is your servant Caius?

speaker: Lear
turn_text: He's a good fellow, I can tell you that. He'll strike, and quickly too. He's dead and rotten.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: No, my good lord; I am the very man-

speaker: Lear
turn_text: I'll see that straight.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: That from your first of difference and decay Have followed your sad steps.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: You're welcome hither.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Nor no man else! All's cheerless, dark, and deadly. Your eldest daughters have fordone themselves, And desperately are dead.

speaker: Lear
turn_text: Ay, so I think.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: He knows not what he says; and vain is it That we present us to him.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Very bootless.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Enter a Captain.

speaker: Captain
turn_text: Edmund is dead, my lord.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: That's but a trifle here. You lords and noble friends, know our intent. What comfort to this great decay may come Shall be applied. For us, we will resign, During the life of this old Majesty, To him our absolute power; [to Edgar and Kent] you to your rights; With boot, and Such addition as your honours Have more than merited.- All friends shall taste The wages of their virtue, and all foes The cup of their deservings.- O, see, see!

speaker: Lear
turn_text: And my poor fool is hang'd! No, no, no life! Why should a dog, a horse, a rat, have life, And thou no breath at all? Thou'lt come no more, Never, never, never, never, never! Pray you undo this button. Thank you, sir. Do you see this? Look on her! look! her lips! Look there, look there!

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: He dies.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: He faints! My lord, my lord!

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Break, heart; I prithee break!

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: Look up, my lord.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: Vex not his ghost. O, let him pass! He hates him That would upon the rack of this tough world Stretch him out longer.

speaker: Edgar
turn_text: He is gone indeed.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: The wonder is, he hath endur'd so long. He but usurp'd his life.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: Bear them from hence. Our present business Is general woe. [To Kent and Edgar] Friends of my soul, you twain Rule in this realm, and the gor'd state sustain.

speaker: Kent
turn_text: I have a journey, sir, shortly to go. My master calls me; I must not say no.

speaker: Albany
turn_text: The weight of this sad time we must obey, Speak what we feel, not what we ought to say. The oldest have borne most; we that are young Shall never see so much, nor live so long.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: Exeunt with a dead march.

speaker: STAGE
turn_text: THE END
